itemDescription: English woman imprisoned on charges of blasphemous libel (1792-?)

wikipedia_page.main: Susannah Wright (1792 - unknown) was an English woman imprisoned on charges of Blasphemous libel for selling works from the shop of radical publisher Richard Carlile. In total, Wright served two years in Newgate and Coldbath Fields prisons, gaining a level of notoriety as the 'She-Champion of Impiety'.
